docs.lead_paragraph: The Republican-led U.S. House of Representatives voted on Wednesday to delay for one year the tax penalty Americans will pay under President Barack Obama's healthcare law if they decline to enroll in health coverage.

headline.main: U.S. House Votes to Delay Obamacare Penalty for Non-Enrollment
headline.print_headline: U.S. House Votes to Delay Obamacare Penalty for Non-Enrollment

docs.snippet: The Republican-led U.S. House of Representatives voted on Wednesday to delay for one year the tax penalty Americans will pay under President Barack Obama's healthcare law if they decline to enroll in health coverage.

docs.lead_paragraph: The House on Wednesday backed a one-year delay in the penalty that individuals would have to pay for failing to sign up for health insurance, the 50th time Republicans have forced a vote to repeal, gut or change the law championed by President Barack Obama.

headline.main: House Backs Bill to Delay Health Care Penalty
headline.print_headline: House Backs Bill to Delay Health Care Penalty

docs.snippet: The House on Wednesday backed a one-year delay in the penalty that individuals would have to pay for failing to sign up for health insurance, the 50th time Republicans have forced a vote to repeal, gut or change the law championed by President Barack...

docs.lead_paragraph: Warding off the specter of election-year health insurance cancellations, the Obama administration Wednesday announced a two-year extension for individual policies that don't meet requirements of the new health care law.

headline.main: 2-Year Extension Offered for Canceled Health Plans
headline.print_headline: 2-Year Extension Offered for Canceled Health Plans

docs.snippet: Warding off the specter of election-year health insurance cancellations, the Obama administration Wednesday announced a two-year extension for individual policies that don't meet requirements of the new health care law.

docs.lead_paragraph: China's government responded to public demands for bold leadership with vows Wednesday to press long-sought market reforms, defend against terrorism after a horrific slashing attack, and heavily boost military spending amid rising tensions with Japan.

headline.main: China Vows Tough Reforms, Stronger Defense
headline.print_headline: China Vows Tough Reforms, Stronger Defense

docs.lead_paragraph: An agency-by-agency summary of President Barack Obama's proposed budget for fiscal 2015, beginning next Oct. 1.
docs.snippet: An agency-by-agency summary of President Barack Obama's proposed budget for fiscal 2015, beginning next Oct. 1.

docs.abstract: Market-based recruitment of participants in field studies might improve the quality of research, an economist writes.
docs.snippet: Market-based recruitment of participants in field studies might improve the quality of research, an economist writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Where is the line between innovation and economic development on one hand and the creation of a permanently disadvantaged class on the other?

docs.lead_paragraph: The plan, which uses federal Medicaid expansion funds to buy private insurance for poor people, is being closely watched by other states.

headline.main: Arkansas House Votes to Extend Health Insurance Program
headline.print_headline: Arkansas House Votes to Extend Health Insurance Program

docs.abstract: Arkansas House of Representatives votes to allow state to keep taking federal money for expansion of Medicaid under Pres Obama's health care law and use it to buy private insurance for poor people.
docs.snippet: The plan, which uses federal Medicaid expansion funds to buy private insurance for poor people, is being closely watched by other states.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: While the new use removes blight, restores health care services and creates jobs, critics worry these facilities are no substitute for the hospitals they’ve replaced.

headline.main: Repurposing Closed Hospitals as For-Profit Medical Malls
headline.print_headline: Repurposing Closed Hospitals as For-Profit Medical Malls

docs.abstract: New Jersey developers have been buying up shuttered hospitals and reopening them as private medical complexes; trend has reduced blight, created jobs and restored much-needed local services as hospitals shut down, but critics worry that they do not provide same level of care; private complexes do not have nonprofit community missions and are able to refuse service to those who cannot afford it.
docs.snippet: While the new use removes blight, restores health care services and creates jobs, critics worry these facilities are no substitute for the hospitals they’ve replaced.

docs.lead_paragraph: Democrats need to wake up and understand the stakes involved in holding on to control of the U.S. Senate in the November congressional elections, President Barack Obama told Democratic Party donors at a fundraiser on Tuesday.

headline.main: Obama Urges Democrats to Wake Up Ahead of Tough Midterm Elections
headline.print_headline: Obama Urges Democrats to Wake Up Ahead of Tough Midterm Elections

docs.snippet: Democrats need to wake up and understand the stakes involved in holding on to control of the U.S. Senate in the November congressional elections, President Barack Obama told Democratic Party donors at a fundraiser on Tuesday.
